name: Shem
blurb: Blessed by Noah, Shem becomes the ancestor of the peoples through whom Abraham arises. In biblical theology, Shem’s line carries the promise forward.
searchText: shem person narrative blessed by noah, shem becomes the ancestor of the peoples through whom abraham arises. in biblical theology, shem’s line carries the promise forward.

name: Enoch (son of Cain)
blurb: Son of Cain for whom Cain builds a city, marking the rise of urban life in a fallen world.
searchText: enoch (son of cain) person genealogy son of cain for whom cain builds a city, marking the rise of urban life in a fallen world.

name: Irad
blurb: Descendant of Cain; part of the early city-building lineage.
searchText: irad person genealogy descendant of cain; part of the early city-building lineage.

name: Mehujael
blurb: Descendant of Cain; his name continues the line that culminates in Lamech.
searchText: mehujael person genealogy descendant of cain; his name continues the line that culminates in lamech.

name: Methushael
blurb: Descendant of Cain; father of Lamech (of Cain’s line).
searchText: methushael person genealogy descendant of cain; father of lamech (of cain’s line).

name: Lamech (descendant of Cain)
blurb: Boastful polygamist who sings of violent revenge; his household nevertheless pioneers crafts and herding—an ambivalent portrait of culture under sin.
searchText: lamech (descendant of cain) person genealogy boastful polygamist who sings of violent revenge; his household nevertheless pioneers crafts and herding—an ambivalent portrait of culture under sin.

name: Ham
blurb: Father of many Near Eastern peoples. The fraught episode with Noah is followed by a curse that falls on Canaan. Israel’s later history often intersects with Ham’s descendants.
searchText: ham person narrative father of many near eastern peoples. the fraught episode with noah is followed by a curse that falls on canaan. israel’s later history often intersects with ham’s descendants.

name: Japheth
blurb: Progenitor of the ‘coastland peoples,’ associated with maritime expansion. Noah’s blessing envisions Japheth dwelling in the tents of Shem.

name: Achan (Achar) son of Carmi
blurb: His hidden theft of devoted things brings communal defeat at Ai. Joshua’s inquiry exposes sin, and judgment restores Israel’s standing. Achan dramatizes how private idolatry imperils a public mission.

name: Sheshbazzar (prince/governor of Judah)
blurb: Persian-appointed leader who receives and transports temple vessels and lays the foundation. Often identified with Shenazzar or linked to Zerubbabel’s early phase.
